title: Full of interest
text: Greenwich Observatory is best approached from the water (you can take a boat from near Tower Bridge). To anyone with a passing interest in time, history, navigation or invention, Greenwich Observatory is a star attraction. Not only can you stand on the prime meridian, you can also take the very interesting and detailed audio tour of the history of longitude. The hill also commands an excellent view of London. There are a number of other attractions nearby, so allow plenty to time to look around.

title: An iconic site
text: Tower Bridge is one of the famous sites of London and clearly seen from the Tower of London. While there are grander bridges in the world, Tower Bridge is so familiar that it is something that must be seen.

title: Much more than we expected
text:
We have stayed at a Sheraton Four Points in North America but nothing could have prepared us for the quality of the one in Dubai. We arrived at the hotel before 7 in the morning after flying in from Athens and, for a modest fee, we could check in straight away. This was very helpful.
The suite, on one of the high floors, consisted of two bedrooms, two bathrooms, a sitting room and dinning room and a full kitchen, not to mention a washing machine and dryer. It was just outstanding.
The hotel has a rooftop swimming pool and a bar with excellent views, especially at night. The staff were only too ready to help with bookings and travel advice.
place: Four Points by Sheraton Sheikh Zayed Road, Dubai

title: Good room and great location
text:
Our stay at the Hotel Plaza L’Etolie on Av de Wagram was a pleasant one. The hotel is very close to the Arc de Triomphe and our room had a view of the Eiffel Tower, a bonus which enhanced our stay. There were also a number of restaurants in our immediate vicinity which was also advantage.

The hotel is compact, especially the corridors and the lift is tiny, barely fitting the four of us. There are some quirky old fashioned features. The room key, for example, is an actual key and they like you to leave it with the front desk when you go out. The staff are also very helpful.

The room was spacious enough for us. Our bed was comfortable and we slept well and there was a sofa bed for the two children. It is worth noting that the website does not confirm that there can be four in a room but we found that the sofa bed was fine for the purpose.

The location, the comfort of the room and the friendliness of the staff made for a very pleasant stay.

title: Great for the fans
text:
You need to book Harry Potter World well in advance of your intended visit. When I booked for us more than a month in advance of our trip, I couldn’t get a morning booking any day of the week we were in London.
Getting to the studio requires taking a train to Watford Junction (we went from Euston) and then a shuttle bus from the station. You need to have cash for the shuttle as they don’t take card.
The tour is for the fans. Detailed sets have been recreated, including the great hall, Daigon Alley and the station platform at Paddington. On the trip you get the chance to ‘ride’ a broom in house robes and buy butterbeer!
The high points for us were the scale model of Hogwarts and the extensive and recently opened Gringott’s Bank, including some impressive visuals of its destruction.
Don’t forget to save time for the shop!
place: Warner Bros. Studio Tour London - The Making of Harry Potter

title: An exceptional experience
text:
The Acropolis is, deservedly, a top drawer experience. The centerpiece of the Acropolis is the Parthenon which you can get close to but not walk through. The complex itself dominates the city and, from the city square, it looks an impossible walk to the top. Fortunately, there is a track which winds around the hill and allows you to get to the top. From the north, though, it is not well signed so it’s a matter of following the crowds to get to the top.
We went there in the afternoon and were able to enter straight away. There are a limited number of days when admission is free so it might be worthwhile checking this out before going.

title: A very good stay
text:
Athens Luxury Apartments is tucked away in what, at first, seems a down-market are but is conveniently located to districts such as Monastiraki and Plaka. Our room, on the fourth floor was spacious and modern, with comfortable bedding. If you book the room with breakfast included, it is available next door.
The service was friendly and the staff were very helpful in providing directions, storing luggage, allowing a late check out and storing luggage. Altogether, we had an excellent stay.

title: An outstanding series of exhibits
text:
The Acropolis Museum is a stand out attraction. The building itself is modern and elegant and beautifully situated. From the top floor there is an excellent view of the Acropolis itself.
There is an extensive collection throughout the museum but the centerpiece is probably the Parthenon Galley with its careful recreation of the Parthenon frieze, complete with reminders that important parts of the Parthenon are in other museums.
To complete the experience, the museum is built over an archaeological excavation which is also a feature.

title: This is a must do when in Paris
text:
The Arc de Triomphe is constructed on a truly grand scale and you get a commanding view down broad, impressive streets. You can also go up to the top for a view of the Paris skyline.
Ensure that you take the tunnels to the Arc itself and not just view it from the surrounding footpaths. I also recommend, if possible, that you view it at night as well as during the day.

title: A Five Star Experience
text:
The Palace of Versailles is an absolute must see on a trip to Paris. The Palace itself is ornate, grand, richly decorated and historically significant. The gardens are also extensive, with the various pools on a grand scale, so you need at least three hours to even begin to do justice to the Palace and the gardens.

The Palace is easily accessed via the Metro, although it takes some planning because the Metro is vast and complex. Nevertheless, we didn’t let that put us off. There are, too, a number of different tickets on offer. My advice is to ensure you have a timed entry one which allows you to skip the line. When we went the line must have been 300-400 meters long. Make sure, too, that you include the gardens in your ticket because they are a vital part of the experience. Be prepared to do lots of walking. Keep in mind that if you do have issues walking there are carts to hire.

title: An Outstanding Experience
text:
The Tower of London is a genuine five star site, especially if you are the slightest bit interested in history. We arrived at opening time where we picked up our on-line tickets. Although getting in was a bit slow, the Tower precinct is big enough for the crowds to be spread out.
There is much to see as sections of the Tower were constructed at different times. The Medieval Palace, the White Tower and the battlements and even the ravens are all fascinating while the Crown Jewels display is not only interesting, the flow of people is well managed. The family consensus was that the display about the death of the Princes during the Wars of the Roses was the highlight of that part of the history which dealt with imprisonment, torture and executions.
The Tower is not to be missed.

title: Delicious food and attentive service
text: After a tiring first day in Paris which included a trip to a police station to report a robbery, we had a really delicious meal, with the two adults eating steak and the two children having pasta. Desert, too, was delicious and we were well looked after by our waiter.

title: Good food but some odd quirks
text:
When we sat down to eat at Monsieur Madame we ordered our food to be told that there would be wait as the kitchen didn’t open until 7.00. Although that meant a half hour wait we had walked so much during the day we didn’t care.
The main courses, when they arrived were delicious and between us we had chicken, salmon and lamb shoulder. They were all so delicious we decided to order desert. Imagine our surprise to find that, of the four deserts we wanted, only two were available. Given we were the first diners of the night we found that strange.
Nevertheless, what we did eat was delicious and the service was good.

title: Good choice for a light lunch
text:
Lafayette café has a surprisingly wide choice and you can, if you like, have a full meal there. We were looking for something simpler and it served our needs well. A very good feature of the café is that there is ample space.
Make sure, too, that you go up to the roof for an excellent view of the Paris skyline.

title: Excellent simple food in a friendly atmosphere
text: Taverna Aris is actually in the market so that the food is as fresh as you can get. It is the place for fresh fish, simply cooked. we were well looked after and were given some extras free of charge. We also had a nice chat with the family which runs the restaurant so we were made to feel very welcome.

title: Well worth doing
text: The London Eye is clearly a must do attraction. We went on a clear morning and bought a ticket which allowed timed entry so that we didn’t have to stand in a queue for very long. While we had great views of Westminster Bridge and the Houses of Parliament, there was a group of tourists who were very loud and not very considerate of others in that they hogged the views a bit.

title: Adventures at the London Metropole!
text:
There are some great features about this hotel. It's in a great location, with two Underground Stations in close proximity and a short walk down to Marble Arch and some good shopping. The lobby is spacious and the restaurant is good - we had both breakfast and one dinner there and had no complaints.
However, the hotel is a bit tired and could do with a design update. I would, for instance, hate to have mobility issues getting into the bath in order to have a shower. And what is it with hotels and their swimming pools? The one here was out of action. I really think that there should be some sort of notification or little sweetener when this happens as it seems to happen far too often.
We had a number of issues with our room and ended up having to move twice!
Despite this, I have to commend the very friendly staff who cheerfully resolved our issues so that, on balance, we had a good stay.

title: Simply the best hot chocolate
text: My title says it all. We have explored several of the hot chocolate places near us but we settled on Choclatte as our venue of choice. The service is excellent and friendly, too.

title: Very good but not cheap
text: Our meal at Richmond Oysters was very satisfying and the service was also very good. Normally, we go out as a family but this time it was just the two of us. That, for me, is the way to go for this venue.

title: Couldn't ask for better steak and ribs
text: We didn't know much about this restaurant before getting there but we were completely satisfied with the steaks and ribs that we ordered. We were there for lunch which was better for us as a family.

title: Good variety of seafood
text: Nick's provides a variety of seafood dishes. The place is large and can be noisy but the food is good and, if travelling with family, there is something for everyone. If you are eating with family it is best to arrive and eat early before all of the crowds.

title: A good safe choice
text: We had a satisfying family meal on a Friday night. The bistro serves a broad range of food so that there is something for everyone and the service is prompt and friendly.
place: The Mallacoota Hotel Motel Family Bistro

title: A beautiful rural retreat
text: We recently spent two nights at the lodge just after the new owners had taken over. They couldn't have been more welcoming to make our stay pleasant. The sitting room, the kitchen and the veranda are all essential features of this traditional lodge. The only down side is the beds which could do with an update.

title: Great Location, good amenities
text: The Amora Jamison is in a great location, not only in terms of the city but it is practically on top of Wynard station. the room was well appointed and the bathroom was spacious. A highlight for us was, surprisingly, the swimming pool, where we spent part of most afternoons.

title: Efficient, busy dinning
text: There is a real buzz about this place. A key to its success is the efficient service which allows you to eat before or after seeing a film at the cinema across the road. The food is good, too, with the pasta bolognese absolutely top drawer and my go-to dish.

title: Consistently good family experience
text: Di Palma's is just the ticket for family dining in the suburbs. While family friendly with very good service, the restaurant has a welcome touch of class. We recommend the Calamari and the Fish Stew for adults and the chicken and chips for the kids.

title: A great place to dine
text: The Keg is well known for the quality of it's steaks and the consistency of the experience. Even though we didn't have a booking they seated us quickly and the service was very attentive and the food was excellent. Another bonus was that this restaurant is easily accessible via the underground city.
place: The Keg Steakhouse + Bar - Place Ville Marie

title: Great for breakfast and brunch
text: We had a terrific and filling late family breakfast one cold morning. The well done, traditional morning favorites like eggs and bacon and pancakes were just what the doctor ordered.

title: Just the place for steak
text: Our dining experience at Vargas was very satisfying for the whole family. I had the lamb shank, my wife and younger daughter had steaks and older daughter had ribs. We were all delighted with our choices.

title: Probably my favourite hotel
text: We have stayed at the Hotel Bonaventure twice and loved it both times. It is unusual in that the hotel is upstairs on the top floor and the design sees a collection of mezzanine floors. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The hotel is in an excellent location across the road from the central railway station and it is linked to the underground city. A feature of the hotel is the pool which is brilliant in summer and equally enticing in winter with snow on the pool deck. Make sure, whatever the season, you use the pool. We found the service excellent. After a mix up resulted in us being offered breakfast on our last morning, we arrived at the dinning room only to find that breakfast wouldn't begin for another half hour. Despite this, the staff very generously allowed us to have our breakfast before we headed off to the airport. Great stuff!

title: Not fashionable but I am a fan
text:
Epcot is not always highly regarded. Certainly, those looking for thrill rides find it a bit 'flat' but the family and I like the park. In terms of attractions, Soarin' and Test Track are really good and are suitable for the whole family. There are some nice rides like Nemo and friends for the younger kids and Mission Space for the slightly more adventurous. We also love the gentle and history laded Spaceship Earth.
At the World Showcase section of the park you will find the best food and best variety in all of the Disney resorts. The Coral Sea Restaurant, Le Cellier, Chefs de France all offer excellent food while the Biergarten and Princess Storybook offer buffets with entertainment.
Lastly, the Illuminations fireworks display is truly spectacular.

title: Too crowded to be really enjoyable
text: While I have enjoyed this park in the past, our experience this time was not as enjoyable. I put this down to the new Pandora ride with wait times in excess of four hours! This seemed to have a ripple effect on the rest of the park which was more crowded than ever before. There are terrific parts to the park such as the safari and the Yeti ride but if you are going to this park get there early.

title: Not a fan
text: For me, this park is a let down. It does not have a strong sense of identity and I missed old staples like the back-lot tour. It seems to be a park in transition, moving from a 'Disney' park to something more like a movie world.

title: Still Magical
text: This attraction is so well known that it is hardly worth trying to review the park. Whether your taste is the more traditional, charming rides like Peter Pan or It's a Small World or the latest like the terrific Snow White ride, the park has something for everyone. We like some of the old staples like Speedway, Pirates and Haunted Mansion. Whatever your taste, it is impossible not to have fun.

title: A very good range of Burgers
text: We had a good, family meal upstairs at the Burger Bar n a freezing, snowy night. The burgers were tasty and juicy and there was an extensive range of burgers. The staff were very accommodating when it came to varying the order.

title: Well worth the visit
text: Notre-Dame in Montreal is a beautiful, old world church full of wood paneling and stained glass. You can feel the history all around you as you walk around the church. We went initially on a Saturday afternoon but were put off by the lines of people waiting in the snow. Going in the morning was much better as we didn't have to wait.

title: An outstanding night out for meat lovers
text: We visited this Australian take on Brazilian churrasco dining on a recent trip and we agreed that this was the best family meal we have had in ages. The service was top class and the meat was tasty and delicious. After the first round of lamb, kangaroo, beef, chicken, spicy sausage and pork we were able to request further specific dishes. An unexpected highlight was the desserts. Especially if bringing the family take advantage, as we did, of the early bird offer for a significantly cheaper meal.

title: Excellent food but slow to arrive
text: We came early to Zinc hoping for a nice meal which we certainly got and the service from the waitress was attentive. However, the food was slow to arrive which, early in the evening, is hard to understand. You know it is slow when the waitress tells you the food should be out soon. I wouldn't let this put you off but be careful taking younger children who might become restless. The meal isn't cheap, either.

title: Good, old fashioned fish and chips
text: This restaurant is something of a throwback to an earlier time. It serves good quality fish and chips in a quaint atmosphere. It is a good place to take the kids.

title: A good walk with great views
text: When we went it was very cold so that took from the experience somewhat but the views of Detroit are excellent when the sun is out and the sculpture park is full of interest.

title: Full of interest
text: We went to the Manor at Christmas time when it was all fitted out for the season. We even had Christmas carols played by bell ringers!. Every room was full of interest and the volunteers who manned every room and answered questions with knowledge and enthusiasm were a real highlight in themselves.

title: Outstanding value for money
text: This modest restaurant, tucked away on the grounds of Windsor University, serves outstanding food at very modest prices. The pasta is very good but I really recommend the mixed grill.

title: Excellent family hotel
text: Embassy Suites are very good choices for families and this Chicago hotel is no exception. Not only are the rooms clean and spacious but the complimentary breakfast is excellent while the evening reception is always a highlight. This hotel is well located and thoroughly recommended.
place: Embassy Suites by Hilton Chicago Downtown Magnificent Mile

title: Excellent food and attentive service
text: We ate twice at the Grand Lux on a recent stay and had excellent, expansive meals. On the first night we ordered two deserts (one had to be ordered early) and we realised that we were too full to eat both. The cafe was quite happy to cancel one. It was much appreciated.

title: Good food and considerate service
text: We had a very good meal at the Weber and were looked after. Our youngest had a steak that was very fatty and they offered us a much appreciated replacement meal which we were able to able to take back to the hotel with us.

title: An impressive river
text: Even in winter this is an impressive walk made even better by the grandeur of many of the beautiful buildings which tower impressively over the city.

title: A must in the cold
text:
You’ll see some ho-hum reviews of the underground city and it is true that it is mostly about shopping and eating. However it is a life saver when it’s cold. We had successive days in the minus 20s with wind chill as well.
Follow the signs carefully though because it is not as easy to navigate as it is above ground. This is because there are narrow connecting passageways and the major areas spread out like a spiderweb.
Take a good map and pay attention to those signs.

title: Rated too highly
text:
Notice I didn’t say overrated which implies it was disappointing just that it is essentially an indoor zoo. While this has some novelty value, real zoos have more to offer.
We went on a very cold day and the lines were very long.

title: An efficient way to cross the border using the bus
text: Using The tunnel bus to cross the border is a good way to move between Detroit and Windsor. Of course you have to deal with the security officers on either side of the tunnel but that has been a fairly speedy experience. When catching the bus back to Windsor avoid the Rosa Parks Terminal. There are other stops you can use.

title: Bright Lights for Christmas at Jackson Park
text: For Christmas, Jackson Park in Windsor is alive with lights at night. While cold it was a lovely family experience. Make sure you prepare for the cold, though.

title: A great tour for the family
text: The Ford factory tour was well worth it. We got historical and modern perspectives from two films and then saw the factory where the F-150 is made. All of us learnt a lot from what was an enjoyable experience. We did this as part of the Museum experience. I recommend it.

title: A top class attraction
text: The Henry Ford Museum of American Innovation is a great museum with some different and unique experiences. When we went we also had the benefit of the Pixar display which had an abundance of hands - on activities for all of the family. The rest of the museum has some extraordinary machines; not just cars but farm equipment, planes and railway engines as well. An unexpected highlight was the Rosa Parks bus, make sure you don't miss it.

title: A good choice near the Airport
text: After flying in from Auckland to Houston, we needed to break our journey and stay overnight near the airport for an early flight the next day. The hotel was perfectly suited to our needs with a comfortable room. We picked this hotel not just for its proximity to the airport but also because it had a restaurant and a free shuttle. The restaurant seemed more like a boozy bar at first which was a bit disconcerting as I was travelling with my two daughters. However, the food was surprisingly tasty and the service sound. The shuttle provided a good service for a very early flight.
place: Sheraton North Houston at George Bush Intercontinental

title: Great, reliable food
text: We recently had an anniversary dinner at the Keg in Windsor. If you have been to one of the other Kegs you will know all about the food and the service both of which were excellent. We had a nice, spacious table and were looked after. My wife and I really appreciated the surprise, one the house, shared dessert for our anniversary.
place: The Keg Steakhouse + Bar - Windsor Riverside

title: Beautiful lights of Christmas
text: This proved to be really nice space full of vibrant lights and a friendly atmosphere on a very cold December night. It was well worth the visit.

title: A pretty decent coffee
text: Roasting plant is a fun place where you can watch coffee beans flying through plastic tubes. The coffee was good and it proved to be a fun place to shelter from some very inclement weather.

title: A great meal out
text: For our last night in Canberra we ate at Black Fire and the meat based meal was a delight. I had the lamb, my wife had the steak, as did our younger daughter, while the older one had the ribs. The meal was perfect and the service was helpful, with our waitress suggesting the desert sharing plate. This proved to be an inspired choice for the family. This was easily the best meal we had in Canberra.

title: A rich, immersive experience
text: The Australian War Memorial is a multi-faceted, serious educational experience. It is full of solemnity and, sometimes, pageantry. The tomb of the unknown soldier evokes the sadness of war, while the displays below ground are so extensive they require most of the day to do them all. All of the Australian conflicts are covered. I particularly recommend searching for relatives on the honour roll (you can use the website to find out which panel the name appears) and the VC awardees section as especially worthwhile.

title: A largely passive experience
text: We were disappointed in our family visit to the National Museum. While there was a lot to look at there wasn't much to really engage you. Other places in Canberra were better experiences for the family.

title: Make sure you see the lobby
text: The Chrysler Building is, in the view of many, the best looking building in NYC. Although the building is not open to the public, the lobby is and is well worth a look despite the somewhat uptight security guards and the many rules you need to follow.
